intro: Stomatanthes polycephalus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10-30 cm, with a compact and bushy appearance. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and are often used in ornamental horticulture. Stomatanthes polycephalus prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
